page.title: 13BATLERS GREEN FARM
page.content: Anyone may see the dairy cows and pigs at Batlers Green Farm. The pigs are in a big shed at the back and cows and calves are at the front in stable-like pens. There are also 8,000 laying chickens and 1,000 broilers, of which 120 are killed every week; their heads are cut off and they are hung upside down to be drained before put into the plucking machine. Mr Tom Haworth, who leases the farm from Hertfordshire County Council, is very interested in conservation. He believes that everything including birds and insects were put here for a reason and should not be considered a nuisance. A few years ago he lost 40 trees from{Dutch Elm Disease}and has gradually been replacing these with oak, field maple and young saplings. He has also provided shelter for many small creatures by improving hedges.
